title: How to find a reason to live - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a very difficult question to answer. I have been in your shoes, and I know how hard it is to find meaning in your life when everything seems bleak and pointless. I struggled with severe depression for two years, and it has only been a year or so since I finally got my life back on track. I would like to share some things that help me find purpose and meaning today. Firstly, I sought help for my problems. I knew I needed it, and though it seemed hopeless at first, it was the crucial starting point for me. I confided in my mom and in my guidance counselor, and both of them helped me to realize that my life didn’t have to be so empty forever. I would recommend that you do the same. What’s the point in holding back from getting help, if all of your self-dignity and confidence is gone anyway? Once I got the moral support that I needed, I really started to get to know myself. I tried my best to learn all of my weaknesses. I learned more about the way I communicated and viewed the world. I took personality tests online, as well as self-tests for depression and anxiety. I found out that I had social anxiety disorder, and I read articles outlining ways to get a hold on anxiety so that it does not control your life. You may or may not suffer from anxiety or depression, but it is a good idea to find out if you do so that you can start the healing process. After that, I found out the true purpose of my life: helping others. I learned that the world truly is a dark and cruel place, but that if you stand by the few people out there who work to penetrate that darkness and let a little light shine through, then you will be happier and more fulfilled. This, and your relationships with others, are the only things that can bring you lasting joy and peace. Once you learn what you are good at doing, then you can use that knowledge to do good in this world. For instance, I learned that I was good at breaking people’s walls, and getting them to open up about what was really going on behind their fake smile and perceived outer confidence. I use my own experiences to help them feel that they are neither alone nor hopeless. I know that you can do this, even if it feels as if you can’t. You are much stronger than you think, and you can make a difference in this world by simply embracing your strengths and using them for everyone’s benefit.
